/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0010

content.p: This chapter and chapters 4503 to 4525 govern compliance with the Ethics in Government Act, Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A. This chapter contains provisions and definitions of general application. This chapter and chapters 4503 to 4525 are adopted pursuant to Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.02, subdivision 13, paragraph (a).

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 1.

content.p: The definitions in this part apply to this chapter and chapters 4503 to 4525 and Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A. The definitions in Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A, also apply to chapters 4503 to 4525.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 2.

content.p: "Address" means the complete mailing address, including the zip code. An individual may use either the person's business address or home address. An association's address is the address from which the association conducts its business.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 2a.

content.p: "Audit trail" means documentation of submission of an electronic file or facsimile transmission to the board. The audit trail includes the date and time at which the facsimile transmission or electronic file submission was made and a copy of any verification report or message received from the board.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 3.

content.p: A "business day" is from 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday, except for official state holidays.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 4.

content.p: "Compensation" means every kind of payment for labor or personal services. Compensation does not include payments of Social Security, unemployment compensation, workers' compensation, or pension benefits.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 4a.

content.p: "Electronic file" means a report or statement required by Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A, and submitted to the board using an electronic filing system.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 4b.

content.p: "Electronic filing system" means the computer-based systems developed by the board to transfer an electronic file of data that meets the filing and reporting requirements of Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 4c.

content.p: "Facsimile transmission" means the use of a fax machine or e-mail to submit an electronic image of a report or statement to the board.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 5.

content.p: "Honorarium" means anything of value given or received for services such as making speeches, writing articles, or making presentations when there is no obligation on the part of the giver to make payment.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 6.

content.p: "Money" means cash and cash equivalents such as checks, money orders, travelers checks, negotiable instruments, and other paper commonly accepted by a bank as a deposit. A transfer of money includes an electronic transfer of funds.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 7.

content.p: "Occupation" means a person's usual trade, profession, employment, or other similar endeavor, and includes categories for which there is no direct financial compensation, such as homemaker.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 7a.

content.p: "Personal identification code" is a confidential user name and password provided by the board and required to use an electronic filing system.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 8.

content.p: A. for an employed person, the name of the employer and the address from which the employee conducts the employer's business;
B. for a self-employed person or a person not employed, the address from which the person conducts business or personal matters; or
C. for an association, the name and business address of the association.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0100/SUBPART 9.

content.p: "Promptly" means within ten business days after the event that gave rise to the requirement.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0200
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0200/SUBPART 1.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0200/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0200/SUBPART 3.

content.p: A "holder of securities" is an individual having an ownership interest in a security, or who is the trustee or beneficiary of a trust having an ownership in a security. An individual owning shares in a mutual fund does not have an ownership interest in underlying securities owned by the fund.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0200/SUBPART 4.

content.p: The value of a security is its fair market value. For securities traded on national exchanges, the fair market value is the closing bid price for the security on a given date. The value of a partial interest in a security is the value of the holder's proportionate share.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0200/SUBPART 5.

content.p: Trustees of associations organized for charitable, philanthropic, religious, social service, educational, or other public use or purpose are not holders of securities owned by the associations.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0300
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0300/SUBPART 1.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0300/SUBPART 1a.

content.p: The original signature of the person responsible for preparation or filing of a report or other document is required to make the report or document complete. Only signed reports or documents may be filed with the board. A document filed by facsimile transmission meets the requirements of this part if the original document being transmitted bears the required signature. An electronic filing meets the requirement of this part if it is submitted with a personal identification code. The board must provisionally accept an initial registration submitted without a personal identification code pending a confirmation of the registration.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0300/SUBPART 2.

content.p: The signature of a person authorized to sign a report or form constitutes certification by that person of the truth and accuracy of the report or form.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0300/SUBPART 3.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0300/SUBPART 4.

p.shortTitle: 4501.0400 DETERMINATION OF LOCAL OR PUBLIC OFFICIAL STATUS.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0400/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Metropolitan governmental units to determine local official status.

content.p: Annually, each metropolitan governmental unit must determine which positions within the metropolitan governmental unit constitute its local officials and must provide the board with a list of those positions.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0400/SUBPART 2.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 2. Acting or part-time local or public official.

content.p: An individual who fills a local or public official position on an acting or part-time basis is a local or public official.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0500
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0500/SUBPART 1.

content.p: A report or statement required under Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A, must be submitted on the forms provided by the board for that purpose or by an electronic filing system. The board may provide alternative methods for submitting information, including other means for the electronic submission of data.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0500/SUBPART 1a.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0500/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0500/SUBPART 3.

content.p: If a scheduled filing date falls on a Saturday, Sunday, or state holiday, the filing is due on the next business day.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0500/SUBPART 4.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0600
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4501/4501.0700

content.p: Late filing fees are not assessed for Saturdays, Sundays, or state holidays.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0010

content.p: This chapter applies to the campaign finance activities of candidates and their principal campaign committees, political party units, political committees, and political funds regulated by Minnesota Statutes, sections 10A.11 to 10A.335.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100/SUBPART 1.

content.p: The definitions in this part apply to this chapter and Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A. The definitions in chapter 4501 and Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A, also apply to this chapter.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100/SUBPART 2.

content.p: "Adjournment sine die" means final adjournment by the legislature in the second year of a biennium.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100/SUBPART 3.

content.p: "Anonymous contribution" means a contribution for which the name and address of the donor cannot be determined.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100/SUBPART 3a.

content.p: "Fair market value" means the amount that an individual would pay to purchase the same or similar service or item on the open market.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100/SUBPART 4.

content.p: "Fundraising event" means a meal, party, entertainment event, rally, or similar gathering of three or more individuals where contributions are solicited or received.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100/SUBPART 5.

content.p: "Receipted bill" means an invoice marked paid by the vendor or a canceled check with a corresponding invoice indicating the purpose of the expenditure.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100/SUBPART 6.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100/SUBPART 7.

content.p: "Statewide election" means an election for a statewide constitutional office, appeals court, or supreme court office, or an election in which a question or proposition on the ballot can be voted on by all voters of the state.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0100/SUBPART 8.

content.p: "Unpaid bill" means an advance of credit for which payment has not been made. An advance of credit is an unpaid bill from the time it is incurred, regardless of when an actual invoice is received.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0200

p.shortTitle: 4503.0200 ORGANIZATION OF POLITICAL COMMITTEES AND POLITICAL FUNDS.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0200/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Organizational information to be provided by a political party.

content.p: The statement of organization of a political party must include a list of the names of the party units organized in each house of the legislature and in congressional districts, counties, legislative districts, municipalities, and precincts, along with the name and address of the treasurer and chair of each unit, and must be updated annually.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0200/SUBPART 2.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 2. Officers of principal campaign committee.

content.p: A candidate may be chair, treasurer, or both, of the candidate's own principal campaign committee. The candidate is ultimately responsible for the principal campaign committee's compliance with Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0200/SUBPART 3.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 3. When registration is not required.

content.p: When a person or group merely solicits contributions with the approval of a candidate or the treasurer, deputy treasurer, or agent of a political committee or political fund and when those contributions are made directly to the reporting committee or fund, that person or group need not establish a separate political committee or political fund.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0200/SUBPART 4.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0200/SUBPART 5.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 5. Termination of responsibility of former treasurer.

content.p: A former treasurer who transfers political committee or political fund records and receipts to a new treasurer or to the chair of the committee or fund is relieved of future responsibilities when notice required under subpart 4 is filed or when the former treasurer notifies the board in writing of the change.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0200/SUBPART 6.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0300

p.shortTitle: 4503.0300 TERMINATION OF POLITICAL COMMITTEE OR POLITICAL FUND.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0300/SUBPART 1.

content.p: A termination report must cover the period from the closing date of the last report filed through the date of termination.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0300/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0300/SUBPART 3.

content.p: An agreement to transfer debts upon the termination of a candidate's principal committee for one office under Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.241, must be made in writing, signed by the candidate and the committee treasurers, and preserved in the records of each committee.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0300/SUBPART 4.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0400
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0400/SUBPART 1.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0400/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500/SUBPART 1.

content.p: Any donation of money, goods, or services received by a principal campaign committee is considered a contribution at the time the item is received.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500/SUBPART 3.

content.p: Promptly after receipt of any contribution or on demand of the treasurer, an individual must transmit the contribution together with any required record to the treasurer.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500/SUBPART 4.

content.p: An individual or association that pays for or provides goods or services, or makes goods or services available, with the knowledge that they will be used for the benefit of a political committee or a political fund, is the contributor of those goods or services.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500/SUBPART 5.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500/SUBPART 6.

content.p: A contribution given by a check written on a joint account is considered to be a contribution by the persons who signed the check in equal proportions unless the candidate or treasurer of the committee or fund has personal knowledge or affirmatively ascertains from any account holder who did not sign the check that the person is a joint contributor. In such cases, a written notation of the basis for considering the contribution to be a joint contribution must be made at the time the contribution is deposited and kept with the committee's or fund's official records.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500/SUBPART 7.

content.p: An anonymous contribution in excess of $20 must be forwarded to the board in its entirety within 14 days after its receipt by the treasurer along with a statement of the amount of the contribution and the date on which it was received.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500/SUBPART 8.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0500/SUBPART 9.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0600
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0600/SUBPART 1.

content.p: A candidate or treasurer of a political committee or political fund may approve the solicitation and collection of campaign contributions through the use of credit cards. An organization that issues credit cards, when acting in the ordinary course of business by collecting and disbursing funds designated by the card holders for contributions to a committee or fund, is not required to register or report.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0600/SUBPART 2.

content.p: A treasurer who reimburses a credit card company for campaign expenditures or noncampaign disbursements that require itemization on a report of receipts and expenditures under Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.20, must disclose the purpose and the name and address of the vendor supplying the good or service for which payment is made.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0700
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0700/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Loans included in aggregation of contributions.

content.p: Contribution limits apply to the aggregation of:
C. outstanding loans from the contributor; and
D. proceeds of outstanding loans endorsed by the contributor.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0700/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0700/SUBPART 3.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0800

p.shortTitle: 4503.0800 DONATIONS IN KIND AND APPROVED EXPENDITURES.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0800/SUBPART 1.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0800/SUBPART 2.

content.p: An approved expenditure made on behalf of multiple candidates must be allocated between the candidates on a reasonable basis if the cost exceeds $20 per candidate.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0800/SUBPART 3.

content.p: A reasonable portion of the fair market value of preparation and distribution of association newsletters or similar materials which, in part, advocate the nomination or election of a candidate is a donation in kind which must be approved by the candidate if the value exceeds $20, unless an independent expenditure is being made.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0800/SUBPART 4.

content.p: The fair market value of shared office space or services provided to a candidate without reimbursement is a donation in kind.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0800/SUBPART 5.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 5. Campaign expenditures for constituent services paid with personal funds.

content.p: Costs of providing constituent services that are campaign expenditures and paid with the personal funds of the candidate are a donation in kind to the principal campaign committee of the candidate.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0900
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0900/SUBPART 1.

content.p: In addition to those listed in Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.01, subdivision 26, the following expenses are noncampaign disbursements:
A. transportation, meals, and lodging paid to attend a campaign school;
B. costs of campaigning incurred by a person with a disability, as defined in Minnesota Statutes, section 363A.03, subdivision 12, and which are made necessary by the disability;
C. the cost to an incumbent or a winning candidate of providing services to residents in the district after the general election in an election year for the office held;
D. payment of advances of credit in a year after the year in which the advance was reported as an expenditure;
E. payment of fines assessed by the board; and
F. costs of running a transition office for a winning gubernatorial candidate during the first six months after election.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0900/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0900/SUBPART 3.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 3. Reporting purpose of noncampaign disbursements.

content.p: Itemization of an expense which is classified as a noncampaign disbursement must include sufficient information to justify the classification.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0950

p.shortTitle: 4503.0950 COSTS OF CONSTITUENT SERVICES AND SERVICES TO RESIDENTS OF CANDIDATE'S DISTRICT WHICH DO NOT REQUIRE REPORTING.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0950/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Services paid with personal funds of candidate.

content.p: A. Constituent services which a principal campaign committee would report as noncampaign disbursements under Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.01, subdivision 26, clause (6), and which are paid for with the personal funds of an incumbent are not reportable.

B. Services for a resident in the candidate's district after a general election, through the end of the year, paid for with the personal funds of an incumbent or the winning candidate are not reportable.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.0950/SUBPART 2.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 2. Constituent services provided as part of official duties and paid through legislative appropriation.

content.p: Constituent services provided by an incumbent as a part of the duties of serving in office and paid for with state funds designated for that use are not reportable under Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1000
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1000/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Inclusion of others without attempt to influence nomination or election.

content.p: Campaign materials, including media advertisements, produced and distributed on behalf of one candidate which contain images of, appearances by, or references to another candidate, but which do not mention the candidacy of the other candidate or make a direct or indirect appeal for support of the other candidate, are not contributions to, or expenditures on behalf of that candidate.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1000/SUBPART 2.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 2. Multicandidate materials prepared by a candidate.

content.p: A candidate who produces and distributes campaign materials, including media advertisements, which include images of, appearances by, or references to one or more other candidates, and which mention the candidacy of the other candidates or include a direct or indirect appeal for the support of the other candidates must collect from each of the other candidates a reasonable proportion of the production and distribution costs.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1100

p.shortTitle: 4503.1100 CARRYFORWARD OF CAMPAIGN FUNDS; UNPAID ADVANCES OF CREDIT.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1100/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Retention for unpaid advances of credit.

content.p: In addition to the carryforward permitted under Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.257, subdivision 1, the treasurer of a principal campaign committee may retain into the next election cycle an amount equal to the sum of all unpaid advances of credit on the last day of the previous election cycle.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1100/SUBPART 2.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 2. Forgiveness and payment of advances of credit.

content.p: When an advance of credit for which funds were retained under subpart 1 is later forgiven or paid by an individual or association other than the principal campaign committee, funds retained under subpart 1 based on the advance of credit must be disposed of pursuant to Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.257, subdivision 1.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1100/SUBPART 3.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 3. Carryforward applies at end of special election cycle.

content.p: The limitations on carryforward of funds imposed by Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.257, subdivision 1, apply at the end of a special election cycle as well as the end of a general election cycle. The limitations at the end of a special or general election cycle apply to all candidates for the office which was the subject of the election regardless of whether the candidate actually ran in the election.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1200

p.shortTitle: 4503.1200 JOINT FUND RAISING EVENTS BY PRINCIPAL CAMPAIGN COMMITTEES.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1200/SUBPART 1.

content.p: Proceeds and costs of joint fund raising events held by two or more principal campaign committees must be allocated in such a way as to avoid earmarking and prohibited transfers or contributions from one principal campaign committee to another.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1200/SUBPART 2.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 2. Elective procedures to assure compliance.

content.p: Principal campaign committees may be certain that allocation of proceeds and costs of a joint fundraising event will not result in earmarking or a prohibited transfer or contribution if:

A. contributions are made individually to each committee by check payable to the committee, by cash given in a separate collection for the committee, or by cash with a record kept of each contributor and recipient;
B. expenses of the event are allocated among the participating committees in direct proportion to the contributions received by each committee; and
C. campaign expenditures and noncampaign disbursements are allocated separately and in the same proportion.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1200/SUBPART 3.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 3. Record keeping and reconciliation of expenses.

content.p: The treasurers of principal campaign committees conducting a joint fund raising event must maintain records of all costs associated with the event. After the conclusion of the event, the treasurers shall complete a reconciliation and allocation of the costs of the event pursuant to this part, and shall make any transfers of funds between the committees necessary to properly allocate the expenses.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1300
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1300/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Seeking endorsement as lieutenant governor.

content.p: Raising and spending funds to seek endorsement as lieutenant governor may be done either through a separate principal campaign committee established by the lieutenant governor candidate or through a joint principal campaign committee of the governor and lieutenant governor candidates.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1300/SUBPART 2.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 2. Separate records for seeking endorsement.

content.p: A principal campaign committee that makes expenditures and authorizes approved expenditures to seek endorsement for the office of lieutenant governor at the convention of a political party and intends those expenditures to be in addition to the expenditure limit established by Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.25, subdivision 2, shall maintain a separate record of those expenditures.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1300/SUBPART 3.

content.p: Separate committees of a candidate for governor and lieutenant governor must be merged not later than five business days after the joint endorsement or filing for office by the candidates for governor and lieutenant governor. The merger must be accomplished by amending the statement of organization of one of the committees making it a joint committee and by terminating the remaining committee. All funds, assets, and debt of the terminated committee must be transferred to the joint committee at the time of the merger. The transfer of debt must be by means of an agreement meeting the requirements of part 4503.0300, subpart 3.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1300/SUBPART 4.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1300/SUBPART 5.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1300/SUBPART 6.

content.p: A public subsidy agreement signed by a candidate for governor or lieutenant governor is binding on both candidates and on the surviving principal campaign committee after a merger accomplished under this part.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400/SUBPART 1.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400/SUBPART 2.

content.p: A public subsidy agreement is effective for the entire election cycle regardless of when the agreement is signed.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400/SUBPART 3.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 3. Effect of signing public subsidy agreement after first year of election cycle.

content.p: By signing a public subsidy agreement after the first year of an election cycle, a candidate agrees to abide by spending and contribution limits for candidates with public subsidy agreements for the entire election cycle. The candidate is subject to the same remedies for prior violations of contribution and spending limits as a candidate who signed a public subsidy agreement during the first year of the election cycle.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400/SUBPART 4.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 4. Effect on right to participate in political contribution refund program.

content.p: The right to issue receipts under the political contribution refund program established in Minnesota Statutes, section 290.06, subdivision 23, arises only when the public subsidy agreement is actually signed.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400/SUBPART 5.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 5. Expiration at end of special election cycle.

content.p: Public subsidy agreements for all candidates in a district in which a special election is held expire at the end of the special election cycle regardless of whether the candidate actually ran in the special election.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400/SUBPART 6.

content.p: If a candidate who has received public subsidy money fails to file a year-end report of receipts and expenditures in an election year, the board may determine the amount of public subsidy which must be returned based on the last report filed by the candidate.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400/SUBPART 7.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 7. Nonreceipt of public subsidy funds.

content.p: A public subsidy agreement is binding regardless of whether the candidate actually receives funds from the state elections campaign fund.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400/SUBPART 8.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1400/SUBPART 9.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1450

p.shortTitle: 4503.1450 DISTRIBUTION OF GENERAL ACCOUNT PUBLIC SUBSIDY FUNDS.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1450/SUBPART 1.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1450/SUBPART 2.

content.p: A candidate who fails to repay money required by the agreement cannot be paid additional general account public subsidy funds during the current or future election cycles until the entirety of the unexpended general account funds, and any associated collection fees, are either repaid to the board or discharged by a court action.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1450/SUBPART 3.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1500
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1500/SUBPART 1.

content.p: An agreement to make a loan to a principal campaign committee or political committee or fund must be made in writing and signed by the borrower and endorsers.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1500/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4503/4503.1500/SUBPART 3.

content.p: A principal campaign committee that does not reimburse an individual or candidate for an expenditure made on behalf of the committee within 18 months of the date on which the expenditure occurred shall convert the unpaid reimbursement into a loan from the individual or candidate to the committee. The unpaid balance of the loan counts against the contribution limit of the individual or candidate for the year in which the expenditure occurred.

content.p: This chapter implements the lobbyist registration and reporting requirements of Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0100
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0100/SUBPART 1.

content.p: The definitions in this part apply to this chapter and Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A. The definitions in chapter 4501 and in Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A, also apply to this chapter.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0100/SUBPART 1a.

content.p: "Designated lobbyist" means a lobbyist responsible for reporting the lobbying disbursements of the entity the lobbyist represents. An entity that employs lobbyists may have only one designated lobbyist at any given time.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0100/SUBPART 2.

content.p: "Gift" has the meaning given in chapter 4512 and Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.071.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0100/SUBPART 3.

content.p: "Lobbying" means attempting to influence legislative action, administrative action, or the official action of a metropolitan governmental unit by communicating with or urging others to communicate with public officials or local officials in metropolitan governmental units. Any activity that directly supports this communication is considered a part of lobbying.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0100/SUBPART 4.

content.p: "Lobbyist's disbursements" include all disbursements for lobbying made by the lobbyist, the lobbyist's employer or employee, or any person or association represented by the lobbyist, but do not include compensation paid to the lobbyist.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0100/SUBPART 5.

content.p: "Original source of funds" means a source of funds, other than the entity for which a lobbyist is registered, paid to the lobbyist, the lobbyist's employer, the entity represented by the lobbyist, or the lobbyist's principal, for lobbying purposes.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0100/SUBPART 6.

content.p: "Public higher education system" includes the University of Minnesota and the Minnesota State Colleges and Universities governed by Minnesota Statutes, chapter 136F. The board may issue advisory opinions at the request of other entities with respect to whether or not they are also included within this definition.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0100/SUBPART 7.

content.p: "Reporting lobbyist" means a lobbyist responsible for reporting lobbying disbursements of two or more lobbyists representing the same entity. Lobbying disbursements made on behalf of an entity may be reported by each individual lobbyist that represents an entity, or by one or more reporting lobbyists, or a combination of individual reports and reports from a reporting lobbyist.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0200
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0200/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Separate registration required for each entity.

content.p: A lobbyist who lobbies on behalf of more than one individual, association, political subdivision, or public higher education system shall register separately for each separate entity. Members or affiliates of an association represented by a lobbyist are not separate entities for the purposes of this requirement.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0200/SUBPART 2.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 2. Separate registration for each lobbyist.

content.p: Multiple lobbyists representing the same individual, association, political subdivision, or higher education system must each register separately. A lobbyist who provides lobbying disbursements to the board through a reporting lobbyist must list the name and registration number of the reporting lobbyist on a lobbyist registration. If the reporting lobbyist changes, or if the lobbyist ceases to report through a reporting lobbyist, the lobbyist must amend the registration within ten days.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0200/SUBPART 3.

content.p: A designated lobbyist must indicate on the lobbyist registration form that the lobbyist will be reporting disbursements for the entity the lobbyist represents. An entity that employs lobbyists may have only one designated lobbyist. A designated lobbyist who ceases to be responsible for reporting the lobbying disbursements of an entity must amend the lobbyist's registration with the board within ten days.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0200/SUBPART 4.

content.p: A reporting lobbyist must indicate on the lobbyist registration form that the lobbyist will be reporting disbursements for additional lobbyists representing the same entity. The registration must list the name and registration number of each lobbyist that will be included in reports of disbursements made by the reporting lobbyist. Changes to the list of lobbyists represented by a reporting lobbyist must be amended on the reporting lobbyist registration within ten days, or provided to the board at the time of filing a report required by Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.04, subdivision 2.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0300

content.p: Individuals or associations represented by lobbyists are presumed to be principals until they establish that they do not fall within the statutory definition of a principal.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0400
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0400/SUBPART 1.

content.p: A lobbyist who has ceased lobbying for a particular entity may terminate registration by filing a lobbyist termination form and a lobbyist disbursement report covering the period from the last report filed through the date of termination. If the lobbying disbursements of the lobbyist are reported by a reporting lobbyist, the nonreporting lobbyist may terminate by filing a lobbyist termination form and notifying the reporting lobbyist of all disbursements made by the lobbyist during the period from the last report filed through the date of termination.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0400/SUBPART 2.

content.p: A reporting lobbyist who has ceased lobbying for a particular entity may terminate registration by filing a lobbyist termination form and a lobbyist disbursement report covering the period from the last report filed through the date of termination. The termination of a reporting lobbyist reverts the reporting responsibility back to each lobbyist listed on the registration of the reporting lobbyist.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0400/SUBPART 3.

content.p: A designated lobbyist who has ceased lobbying for a particular entity may terminate registration using the procedure provided in subpart 1. When the designated lobbyist of a lobbying entity terminates, the entity is responsible to assign the responsibility to report entity lobbying disbursements to another lobbyist.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0500
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0500/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Separate reporting required for each entity.

content.p: A lobbyist must report separately for each entity for which the lobbyist is registered, unless the disbursements are reported in the manner provided in subpart 2.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0500/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0500/SUBPART 3.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 3. Report of officers and directors information.

content.p: With each report of lobbyist disbursements, a designated lobbyist must report any change in the name and address of:
A. each person, if any, by whom the lobbyist is retained or employed or on whose behalf the lobbyist appears; or
B. if the lobbyist represents an association, each officer and director of the association.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0500/SUBPART 4.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 4. Limitation on reporting of loans.

content.p: A lobbyist is not required to report loans to a public official or a local official in a metropolitan governmental unit if:
A. the lobbyist's employer, principal, or association represented which made the loan is a financial institution; and
B. the loan was made in the ordinary course of business on substantially the same terms as those prevailing for comparable transactions with other persons.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0500/SUBPART 5.

content.p: A gift to a public or local official from a principal for which a lobbyist is registered must be reported by the designated reporting lobbyist.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0600
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0600/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Determination of actual costs required.

content.p: To the extent that actual costs of lobbying activities can be obtained or calculated by reasonable means, those actual costs must be determined, recorded, and used for reporting purposes.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0600/SUBPART 2.

content.p: If the actual cost of a lobbying activity cannot be obtained or calculated through reasonable means, those costs must be reasonably approximated.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0600/SUBPART 3.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 3. Disbursements allocated between multiple entities.

content.p: A disbursement for lobbying purposes that benefits more than one entity for which a lobbyist is separately registered must be allocated between the entities benefited on a reasonable basis and reported based on that allocation.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0600/SUBPART 4.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 4. Disbursements which are only partially in support of lobbying.

content.p: A disbursement that is partially in support of lobbying and partially for a nonlobbying purpose must be allocated on a reasonable basis between the two purposes and the portion which is for lobbying activities must be reported.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0600/SUBPART 5.

content.p: Lobbying disbursements must be reported based on the categories in items A to I.
A. "Lobbying materials" includes the cost of production, purchase, or other acquisition of materials that directly support lobbying.

B. "Media costs" includes the cost of media space or time, including website design and maintenance, used for lobbying activities. The cost of preparation of materials for use in the media is reported in the lobbying materials category.

C. "Telephone and communications" includes costs for local and long-distance telephone services, electronic mail, pagers, cellular telephones, facsimile distribution services, telegraph, and other communications services.
D. "Postage and distribution" includes costs of postage from the United States Postal Service as well as other distribution costs associated with lobbying activities.
E. "Fees and allowances" includes fees for consulting, surveys, polls, legal counsel, or other services as well as expenses associated with those services.
F. "Entertainment" includes costs of all entertainment associated with any situation where lobbying activities take place.
G. "Food and beverages" includes costs of all food and beverages associated with any situation where lobbying activities take place.
H. "Travel and lodging" includes costs of all travel and lodging associated with any lobbying activity, excluding the costs of the lobbyist's own travel to accomplish the lobbying activity.
I. "Other disbursements" includes general administration and overhead and any other lobbyist disbursements not reported in other categories.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0600/SUBPART 6.

content.p: The reporting requirements in this part do not change the scope of the statutory prohibition under Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.071, nor do they create additional exceptions to that prohibition.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0700
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0700/SUBPART 1.

content.p: Compensation paid to a lobbyist for lobbying is not reportable by the lobbyist as a lobbyist disbursement.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0700/SUBPART 2.

content.p: Compensation for lobbying paid by a lobbyist principal to a lobbyist or to the employer of a lobbyist must be included when determining the spending level categories for reporting by the lobbyist principal.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0800
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0800/SUBPART 1.

content.p: An administrative action to adopt, amend, or repeal rules pursuant to Minnesota Statutes, chapter 14, begins on publication of the notice required under Minnesota Statutes, section 14.101, subdivision 1, or at an earlier time when the official, board, commission, or agency undertaking the rulemaking takes the first formal action required by law to begin the rulemaking process. An administrative action for a purpose other than rulemaking begins when the commission or agency undertaking the action takes the first formal action required by statute to begin the action or as otherwise defined by statute.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4511/4511.0800/SUBPART 2.

content.p: Participation on an administrative rulemaking advisory committee established under Minnesota Statutes, section 14.101, subdivision 2, is not lobbying.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0010

content.p: This chapter applies to the prohibition of certain gifts pursuant to Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.071.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0100
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0100/SUBPART 1.

content.p: The definitions in this part apply to this chapter and Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.071. The definitions in chapter 4501 and in Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A, apply to this chapter.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0100/SUBPART 2.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0100/SUBPART 3.

content.p: In addition to those categories specified in Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.071, subdivision 1, the following are included within the definition of gift:
B. loans of personal property for less than payment of fair market value;
C. giving preferential treatment for purchases;
E. payment of loans or other obligations.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0100/SUBPART 4.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0100/SUBPART 5.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0200

p.shortTitle: 4512.0200 GIFTS WHICH MAY NOT BE ACCEPTED.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0200/SUBPART 1.

content.p: An official may not accept a gift given by a lobbyist or lobbyist principal or given as the result of a request by a lobbyist or lobbyist principal.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0200/SUBPART 2.

p.shortTitle: Subp. 2. Use of gift to metropolitan governmental unit.

content.p: An official may not use a gift given by a lobbyist or lobbyist principal to a metropolitan governmental unit until the gift has been formally accepted by an official action of the governing body of the metropolitan governmental unit.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0300

p.shortTitle: 4512.0300 GIFTS PAID FOR BY THIRD PARTIES.

content.p: A gift is given by the individual or association paying for the gift or reimbursing another for the gift.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0400

p.shortTitle: 4512.0400 GIFTS PARTIALLY PAID FOR BY LOBBYIST OR LOBBYIST PRINCIPAL.

content.p: An official must contemporaneously reimburse the lobbyist or lobbyist principal for the fair market value of any part of a gift paid for by the lobbyist or lobbyist principal.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0500

p.shortTitle: 4512.0500 WHEN A GIFT IS REQUESTED BY LOBBYIST OR LOBBYIST PRINCIPAL.

content.p: A gift is requested by a lobbyist or lobbyist principal if it is the direct result of a request, suggestion, or other affirmative effort by the lobbyist or lobbyist principal.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0600
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0600/SUBPART 1.

p.shortTitle: Subpart 1. Payment for goods and services.

content.p: Payment of the regular price for goods or services provided by an official or an official's business is not a gift to the official.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4512/4512.0600/SUBPART 2.

content.p: A salary increase, promotion, or change from part-time to full-time status for an official who is an employee is not a gift to the official.

content.p: This chapter applies to the conduct of hearings, audits, and investigations by the board.

content.p: "Complaint" means a written statement, including any attachments, that:
A. alleges that the subject named in the complaint has violated Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A, or another law under the board's jurisdiction; and
B. complies with the requirements in part 4525.0200, subpart 2.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0100/SUBPART 2b.

content.p: "Complainant" means the filer of a complaint.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0100/SUBPART 3.

content.p: "Contested case" means a proceeding conducted under Minnesota Statutes, chapter 14, in which the legal rights, duties, or privileges of specific parties are required by law or constitutional right to be determined after a board hearing. "Contested case" includes a proceeding pursuant to a request for exemption from campaign reporting requirements under Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.20, subdivisions 8 and 10; a hearing ordered by the board under part 4525.0900, subpart 2, concerning a complaint, investigation, or audit; and any other hearing which may be ordered by the board under parts 4525.0100 to 4525.1000 or which may be required by law.
"Contested case" does not include a board investigation or audit conducted under Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.022, subdivisions 1 and 2.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0100/SUBPART 4.

/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0100/SUBPART 8.

content.p: "Respondent" means the subject of a complaint, an investigation, or an audit.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0150
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0150/SUBPART 1.

content.p: This part applies to all complaints, investigations, and audits conducted under this chapter and Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0150/SUBPART 2.

content.p: Whenever notice is required, if a respondent is registered with the board, notices must be sent by electronic and United States mail to the most recent addresses that the respondent provided in a registration statement filed with the board.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0150/SUBPART 3.

content.p: When a provision in this chapter or Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A, provides that a complainant or a respondent has an opportunity to be heard by the board, the complainant or respondent must be given an opportunity to appear in person at a board meeting before the board makes a determination on the matter. The complainant or respondent is not required to appear before the board.

A complainant or respondent who has an opportunity to be heard may submit a written statement to the board in addition to or in lieu of an appearance before the board. A written statement under this part must be submitted prior to or at the board meeting at which the matter will be heard. The executive director must provide any submitted statement to the board before the board makes a determination on the matter.
The opportunity to be heard does not include the right to call witnesses or to question opposing parties, board members, or board staff.
The board may set a time limit for statements to the board when necessary for the efficient operation of the meeting.

When notice of the opportunity to be heard has been sent as required in subpart 2, the failure to appear in person or in writing at the noticed meeting constitutes a waiver of the opportunity to be heard at that meeting.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0150/SUBPART 4.

content.p: The board may continue a matter to its next meeting if:
B. the investigation is not complete;
C. the respondent shows good cause for the continuance; or
D. the delay is necessary to equitably resolve the matter.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0150/SUBPART 5.

content.p: The provisions of this chapter do not affect the board's authority under Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.022, subdivision 2, to order an investigation or audit in any matter.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0200
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0200/SUBPART 1.

content.p: A person who believes a violation of Minnesota Statutes, chapter 10A, or another provision of law placed under the board's jurisdiction by Minnesota Statutes, section 10A.022, subdivision 3, or rules of the board has occurred may submit a written complaint to the board.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0200/SUBPART 2.

content.p: Complaints must be submitted in writing. The name and address of the person making the complaint must be included on the complaint and it must be signed by the complainant or an individual authorized to act on behalf of the complainant. A complainant shall list the alleged violator and the alleged violator's address if known by the complainant and describe the complainant's knowledge of the alleged violation. Any evidentiary material should be submitted with the complaint. Complaints are not available for public inspection or copying until after the board makes a finding.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0200/SUBPART 3.
/US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0200/SUBPART 4.

content.p: Evidentiary testimony given in a meeting conducted by the board under this chapter must be under oath. Arguments made to the board that do not themselves constitute evidence are not required to be under oath.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0200/SUBPART 5.

content.p: Any portion of a meeting during which the board is hearing testimony or taking action concerning any complaint, investigation, preparation of a conciliation agreement, or a conciliation meeting must be closed to the public. The minutes and tape recordings of a meeting closed to the public must be kept confidential.

hcontainer.class: /US/US-MN/MINNESOTA_ADMINISTRATIVE_RULES/Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board 4501 to 4525/4525/4525.0200/SUBPART 6.

content.p: At any time during an investigation of a complaint, the board may hold a contested case hearing before making a finding on the complaint.
